questions.prompt: John Cena, Amar'e Stoudemire, Tony Romo, Chris Evert, and (most prominently) LeBron James are athletes who appear in what successful 2015 comedy film?

In geometry, a polyhedron is a solid figure with four or more plane faces. Five different types of polyhedra fit the definition of a regular polyhedron. The number of faces of each of these five regular polyhedra, when added together, total what number? (Note, your answer should be one number.)

Public (and at times litigious) feuds with fellow writers Truman Capote, William F. Buckley Jr., and Norman Mailer were among the nonliterary highlights (or lowlights) in the life of what American novelist and essayist?

A 1983 duet by Paul McCartney and Michael Jackson shares a particular naming convention with Mötley Crüe's fourth studio album, Destiny's Child's first chart-topping single, and a Phillip Phillips tune used in commercials for American Family Insurance. What is the title of that McCartney/Jackson song?
Of the dozens of inhabited islands that are part of the republic of Greece, the largest in size (by surface area) is Crete, by a wide margin.  Name any one of the next three largest in size.

In cuisines of South Asia, this word is used most commonly for a split, dried pulse (often lentils, sometimes peas, beans, etc.) or for a dish prepared using the ingredient. Varieties include channa, masoor, dhaba, urad, and rajma, among many others. What is this word?
